Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2011 09:12AM murphac wrote: I'm new to the site and don't know much yet, but I'm here!  I hope your biopsy results are good.  Please post when you find out.
Posts.Title: The Wait Faith1213 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: murphac wrote: Hi all, My doctor found a mass during my WWE last week, and I had a mammogram and ultrasound on Wed of this week.  The report reads: "Ultrasound reveals a lobular somewhat shadowing mass...Impression: New right breast mass.  Although this could represent a fibroadenoma the ultrasound appearance is somewhat troublesome and biopsy is recommended." It's bi-rads category IV.  The ultrasound tech told me that she was calling it a 50-50 chance right now.  My biopsy is this coming week. I've already looked it up, and I know that the "lobular shadowing" language can refer to Invasive Lobular Carcinoma.  I'm 37 and really don't have any risk factors for BC. Thoughts?  I can't decide how nervous I should be about this.  I'd appreciate any input you can give!  Thanks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: "Lobular somewhat shadowing" - concerned? murphac marie5890
